steps.title: The Old Way
steps.narration: Imagine building a house. In the old days, you had to make every brick by hand, one by one. It took forever! Coding used to be the same‚Äîevery line written manually.

steps.title: Machines Help
steps.narration: Then machines came along that could make bricks faster. Frameworks and libraries helped programmers reuse code. But you still had to stack every brick yourself.

steps.title: AI Assistants Arrive
steps.narration: Now imagine you have a super-smart robot helper. You tell it: Build me a wall here, make it 10 feet tall, paint it blue. And it does it!

steps.title: Tools Like Cursor
steps.narration: That's what AI coding tools like Cursor do for programmers. You describe what you want, and AI helps you build it. You don't have to type every single line of code!

steps.title: You Are the Architect
steps.narration: You're no longer just a brick-stacker‚Äîyou're an architect who designs and directs. Your job isn't to type fast. Your job is to think clearly and communicate well.

steps.title: The Stone Age
steps.narration: In the Stone Age of computing, programmers used punch cards. They literally punched holes in cards to give instructions. One mistake meant starting over!

steps.title: The Bronze Age
steps.narration: The Bronze Age brought real keyboards and screens. Programmers could finally type code and see it immediately. Still slow, but a huge improvement!

steps.title: The Iron Age
steps.narration: The Iron Age introduced frameworks‚Äîpre-built toolkits that handled common tasks. React, Django, Rails‚Äîthese let developers build faster than ever.

steps.title: The Age of Architects
steps.narration: Right now, we're entering the Age of Architects. This is an exciting time! Programmers who learn to work with AI will build amazing things faster than ever before.

steps.title: Your Opportunity
steps.narration: You're learning at the perfect time! The rules of programming are changing, and those who adapt will have superpowers. Welcome to the future.

steps.title: Skills That Faded
steps.narration: Some skills used to be essential. Memorizing every command. Typing super fast. Writing every line by hand. Remembering tiny syntax details. These still help, but they're less critical now.

steps.title: Understanding Deeply
steps.narration: The first new superpower is understanding how things work. When you truly understand the concepts, you can guide AI to build the right solution, even if you don't remember exact syntax.

steps.title: Communicating Clearly
steps.narration: The second superpower is explaining what you want. The clearer you describe your goal, the better AI can help you. Vague instructions give vague results!

steps.title: Reading Code Critically
steps.narration: The third superpower is reading and checking code. AI generates code, but you must review it. Understanding what code does is more important than writing it from scratch.

steps.title: Planning with Diagrams
steps.narration: The fourth superpower is drawing diagrams to plan. Before you build, sketch your ideas. Flowcharts, sequence diagrams, and box diagrams help you and AI understand the goal.

steps.title: The Modern Programmer
steps.narration: The best programmers aren't the fastest typists. They're the best thinkers and communicators. Master these four skills, and you'll thrive in the Age of Architects!

questions.question: In the Age of Architects, what is your main role?
options: Type code as fast as possible
Design and direct‚Äîtell AI what to build
Write every line of code by hand
questions.explanation: Like an architect designing a building, your job is to think clearly and direct AI. The AI helps with the typing; you do the thinking and designing!

questions.question: What do AI coding tools like Cursor help you do?
options: Build things faster by generating code from descriptions
questions.explanation: AI coding tools help you build faster by turning your descriptions into code. You're still in charge‚Äîyou just have a powerful helper!

questions.question: Why is the house-building metaphor useful for understanding the change?
options: It shows how AI automates the repetitive work while you design
questions.explanation: The metaphor shows how, like moving from hand-making bricks to directing robots, programmers now design and direct while AI handles repetitive coding.

questions.question: What did programmers use in the Stone Age of computing?
questions.explanation: In the earliest days of computing, programmers used punch cards‚Äîphysical cards with holes punched in specific patterns to represent instructions.

questions.question: What major improvement came in the Iron Age of coding?
questions.explanation: The Iron Age brought frameworks‚Äîpre-built toolkits that handle common tasks. These let developers build faster by reusing well-tested code.

questions.question: Why is NOW a great time to learn programming?
options: The rules are changing, and adapters will have superpowers
questions.explanation: The rules of programming are changing with AI tools. Those who learn to work with AI‚Äîrather than ignore it‚Äîwill have incredible advantages!

questions.question: In the Age of Architects, what is the MOST important skill?
options: Thinking clearly and explaining what you want
questions.explanation: AI can type the code, but YOU need to think and communicate clearly! The clearer your thinking and explanation, the better AI can help.

questions.question: Why is reading code more important now than writing it from scratch?
options: It isn't‚Äîwriting is still more important
AI generates code that you must review and understand
questions.explanation: AI generates code, but you're responsible for understanding and verifying it works correctly. Reading critically is essential!

questions.question: How do diagrams help in modern programming?
options: They make your code run faster
They help you and AI understand what you're building before you build it
questions.explanation: Diagrams help you plan your ideas before coding. When you and AI both understand the goal clearly, building becomes much easier!
